body.p: This document appears to be a land cadastre/register. It pertains to the Pondicherry area and three territorial divisions (tālūkkā) thereof: the Putuccēri-t-tālūkkā (Pondicherry), the Villavanallūr-tālūkkā (actual Villianour/Villiyaṉūr), and the Pākūr-tālūkkā (Bahour). For each tālūkkā, is first provided a list of ayaṉkiṟāmams (Government land) and associated matuṟākiṟāmams (sweet land, that is, land free from saline impregnation [see Wilson 1855, p. 315, s.v. Madhu, on the term madhurī, as used in Cuttack region] or toddy land [see MTL, s.v. maturai, "spirituous liquor"]?). The matuṟākiṟāmams are either named or given the status of {puṉcey} (land fit for dry cultivation only). For each tālūkkā, an individual total is given, making the distinction between amāṉi ayaṉkiṟāmams (government managed land) and koṅceciyakiṟāmams (leased land, from French “concession”?). Finally (f10v, c9–10) an overall total is given for the three tālūkkās making the distinction between ayaṉkiṟāmam (that is, amāṉi ayaṉkiṟāmam) and koṅceciyakiṟāmam.
The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:

10 folios, Tamil foliation {mutal} for folio 1, then 2‒10. This foliation is, unusually, found below the single hole on each recto folio. Another numbering is found in the margin, individualised per division (tālūkkā), starting with the second folio pertaining to the concerned division. The lay-out of the pages is in columns.
It seems that the abbreviation {poṉ} ("gold") is used in the left margin in the same function as the piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, which is sometimes used instead.

Folio 1, recto = incipit: about Putuccērittālūkkā.
(f1r, lm) {poṉ}
(f1r, c1, 1) putuccērittālūkkā
(f1r, c1, 2) Ayaṉkiṟāmam – matuṟākiṟāmam
(f1r, c2) {mutal} vatu [i.e. mutal-āvatu]
(f1r, c3, 1) Ayaṉkiṟāmam – Ālankuppam
(f1r, c3, 2) matuṟā [i.e. matuṟākiṟāmam] cañcīviṟāyaṉpēṭṭai
(f1r, c4) 2 vatu [i.e. Iraṇṭ-āvatu]
(f1r, c5, 1) Ayaṉkiṟāmam – Apiṣekapāk=kam
(f1r, c5, 2) matuṟā – māmpaṭṭu
(f1r, c5, 3) Āṇṭiyapāḷaiyam
(f1r, c5, 4) karikkañcēri
(...)

Folio 2, recto: marginal numbering.
(fr, lm) {poṉ} 2 pu [i.e. putuccēri]
(...)

Folio 2, verso: total for Putuccērittālūkkā.
(...)
(f2v, c5, 1) {Āka}
(f2v, c6, 1) Amāṉi Ayaṉkiṟāmam 10
(f2v, c6, 2) koṅceciyakiṟāmam 2
(f2v, c6, 3) {Āka} kiṟāmam 12

Folio 3, recto: about Villavanallūrtālūkkā.
(f1r, lm) {(poṉ/pcs)}
(f3r, c1, 1) villavanallūrtālūkkā
(f3r, c1, 2) Ayaṉkiṟāmam – matuṟākiṟāmam
(f3r, c2) {mutal} vatu
(f3r, c3, 1) Ayaṉkiṟāmam – Aṟacūr
(f3r, c3, 2) matuṟā {puṉcey}
(f3r, c4) 2 vatu
(...)

Folio 4, recto: marginal numbering.
(fr, lm) {poṉ} 2 vi [i.e. villavanallūr]
(...)

Folio 9, recto: marginal numbering.
(fr, lm) {pcs} 3 pā [i.e. pākūr]
(...)

Folio 10, verso = excipit: total for Pākūrtālūkkā; total for the three tālūkkās.
(...)
(f10v, c7, 1) {Āka}
(f10v, c8, 1) Ayaṉ Amāṉikiṟāmam 29
(f10v, c8, 2) koṅceciyakiṟāmam {puṉcey}
(f10v, c9, 1) {Āka} tālūkkā 3kki
(f10v, c10, 1) Ayaṉkiṟāmam 88
(f10v, c10, 2) koṅceciyakiṟāmam 5
(f10v, c10, 3) {Āka} kiṟāmam 93

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
